subject: Learning
title: Decay vs Retrieval Failure
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Decay vs Retrieval Failure.

hook.text: Is a forgotten memory gone forever, or just lost in the filing system?

buildup.text: Decay theory says unused memories physically fadeâ€”the neural trace weakens over time.

discovery.text: Retrieval failure theory says the memory still exists; you just can't find the right cue.

twist.text: Evidence supports both. Some memories decay, others resurface with the right trigger years later.

climax.text: A scent from childhood can unlock a memory you thought was gone for decades.

punchline.text: Some memories die. Others just hide.

quiz.question: What does retrieval failure theory propose?
options: The memory exists but the cue to access it is missing
